translation: (1) When the sky has split [open]
(2) And has listened [i.e., responded][1888] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
footnotes: [1888]- It will have heard Allāh's command and will have inclined immediately to compliance and willing obedience.

translation: (3) And when the earth has been extended[1889]
footnotes: [1889]- i.e., stretched flat and spread out.

translation: (4) And has cast out that within it[1890] and relinquished [it]
footnotes: [1890]- Of the dead and all else buried therein.

translation: (5) And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] –

arabic_text: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
translation: (6) O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion[1891] and will meet it.[1892]
footnotes: [1891]- i.e., striving throughout your life until you meet your Lord, hastening toward death. [1892]- i.e., you will find all that you intended and accomplished awaiting you in the Hereafter. Another meaning is "And will meet Him [i.e., your Lord]" and be recompensed in full by Him.

translation: (7) Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
(8) He will be judged with an easy account
(9) And return to his people in happiness.

arabic_text: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ
translation: (10) But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
(11) He will cry out for destruction
(12) And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
(13) Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
(14) Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].

arabic_text: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا
translation: (15) But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.
(16) So I swear by the twilight glow
(17) And [by] the night and what it envelops
(18) And [by] the moon when it becomes full
(19) [That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.[1893]
footnotes: [1893]- i.e., various stages, both in this life and in the Hereafter.

translation: (20) So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

arabic_text: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩
translation: (21) And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?
(22) But those who have disbelieved deny,
(23) And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
(24) So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ
translation: (25) Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
